Hi, I need to list blog posts filtered by a specific topic and ordered by publish date. If I list the posts by hubl then I can filter and get posts filtered by a topic but there is no sort function there. If I list posts by using Blog Post API then I can sort by publish date but there is no topic filter in HubSpots blog post API. Is there a way to filter posts by a topic and sort by publish date?
I can not use an if in the loop to skip some posts, needs pagination also.
Is there a variable for the from email address in HubSpot?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
The data returned are in a dictionary? I think about 'dictsort' filter if yes. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters>
Or 'sort' filter.

So, a while back I mentioned that someone on my team found a security vulnerability with HubSpot.  Turn out I was incorrect, the vulnerability wasn’t directly an issue with HubSpot, but in fact with the code I had written.

Long story short, if you are ever going to print `{{ request.query_dict }}` anywhere in the DOM, make sure you add the escape filter, i.e. `{{ request.query_dict.category|escape }}`

This was completely new to me, so I figured it would be worth sharing in case anyone else has accidentally created an XSS vulnerability while trying to make a dynamic page
We may be able to add a warning here when accessing this variable to escape it if being used in the DOM.
That would be pretty cool <@U6GNQ7JBU>
Hey I'm in need of some help with some code. I'm not sure if it's the code or something HubSpot Internal.

Anyone else has issues with YouTube videos getting new class names and inline styles? This is a YouTube video embedded on a blog post. Seems to happen when a blog post gets updated. Then the existing videos get the new classes. And this breaks everything :disappointed:

Hey <@UBF61JD2R>, the rich text embed plugin went through an update recently to improve the responsive nature of certain video embeds (including YouTube) so those new classnames & inline styles are expected. This allows for the option of `full-width` as well as wysiwyg responsiveness in the editor.

With that said, they should be providing parity with the existing videos that are being transformed. Can you describe in more detail what issue you are experiencing? If possible a link to the blog editor would be helpful for debugging. Thanks!
You can `Override default settings` for a specific domain in the `Settings`, if that is what you want.

Hey <@UN0NUBU3S>,

Here is an article where it happened: <https://www.inlink.se/blogg/strategi-guide-salj-marknadsforing-vardeproposition>

The new styling happens and the old class names disappear when I press update in the content editor. I can override the inline styles with !important but if there is going to be two different class names I will need to update our base.css in a lot of portals :confused:

anywhere you might write the same code twice e.g. pagination, header, footer, etc..

can't say that i have. the module is a partial in most of my use cases
